text: [Music]
[Applause]
[Music]
hello I am agniv a technical account
manager here at the AWS office in Boston
today I am going to show you how to find
out which Amazon simple storage service
buckets allow red access or write access
from the internet using AWS config let's
get started
Amazon S3 has a feature in the console
that indicates if a bucket is publicly
accessible in addition AWS config
service can also assist to identify the
S3 buckets that allow both public read
and write access from the internet
please note this video assumes that AWS
config service is already activated for
the AWS account and that recording is
turned on be sure that you set up AWS
config on your AWS account open the AWS
Management console and then go to Amazon
S3
note that we have already created two
test buckets for this demo
we can see that the test bucket read
Internet bucket has public read access
turned on
also note that tastebucket read write
internet bucket has public read write
access turned on
now go to AWS config
from the left navigation pane choose
rules then select add rule
in the search bar enter S3 bucket public
read prohibited
then choose the S3 bucket public read
prohibited rule
this rule Flags buckets that allow
public read access as non-compliant
choose next
choose add rule
in the search bar enter S3 bucket public
write prohibited
then choose the S3 bucket public write
prohibited rule
this rule Flags buckets that allow
public write access as non-compliant
choose next
choose add rule
it might take several minutes for AWS
config to complete the evaluation of
your S3 buckets based on the new rules
after the AWS config evaluation is
complete open the rules page from the
AWS config console
then open each rule to see which S3
buckets are flagged as non-compliant
non-compliant buckets are those that
allow either public read access or
public right access from the internet we
can see that AWS config rule S3 bucket
public right prohibited marked the
bucket test bucket read write internet
as non-compliant
similarly the AWS config rule S3 bucket
public read prohibited marked both
buckets as non-compliant
so now you know how to find out which S3
buckets allow read access or write
access from the internet using AWS
config thanks for watching and happy
cloud computing from all of us here at
AWS
[Music]
[Applause]
thank you
foreign
[Music]
